resources.string: Choose terminal color.\nVim\'s text colors can also be changed using colorscheme (256 colors).
Treat Ambiguous Characters as full width character for East Asian fonts. (:help ambiwidth)
`.vimrc` and `.vim` are read from `$HOME` and the startup directory is set to `$HOME`

HOME directory:
You can use the "SELECT" button to change the HOME directory.
However, if you change the HOME directory, you will not be able to change the attributes of the file.
You can restore the home directory to the default value by pressing "Default" button.

viminfo:
Since viminfo requires an attribute change, please add `set viminfo+=n$APPFILES/home/.viminfo` to .vimrc.

How to quit:
- Type ":qa".
- Double tap -> "QUIT".

Toggle keyboard
- Back button.

Vim tutorial:
- Tap "Vim tutorial" from the long press menu or type ":Vimtutor".

Direct input:
- If you need to enable word suggestions or to input Non-Alphanumeric characters, tap "◇" button. 
- One-line text box can be turned on/off by double tap near the bottom of the screen.

Clipboard:
- Please use "Share" intent or Vim command for paste.

Vim command:
"*p - From the clipboard to Vim.
"*y - From Vim to the clipboard.
gY - From the unnamed register to the clipboard. (Only on DroidVim)

.vim and .vimrc:

`$HOME` is deleted when uninstalling. So we recommended copy `.vim` and `.vimrc` to internal storage (It can be accessed via filer app) and edit .vimrc via long press menu.
	 HTML and Links:
 
 Open the HTML file in the browser.
 - "Menu" -> "Share" -> "File"
 - `:ShareIntent file`
 
 gx - open URL under the cursor (:h gx)	 Clipboard commands

 Vim command:
 - "*p - Paste from the clipboard.
 - "*yy - Copy to the clipboard.
 
 Only on DroidVim:
 - gY - unnamed register to the clipboard (e.g. yygY)
 - "Menu"->"Share"	 By default direct input is forced, so you may not be able to input your (Non-English)language.
In that case please try the following:

- ◇ Button
- IME shortcuts(physical keyboard)
- Change "Input mode at startup" to "Normal input"	 Keep screen:

Temporarily change the time to sleep.
 - "Menu"->"Screen"->"Keep screen" 	You can change the keyboard input mode from Vim script.
 
 :call ATEMod(55)
 
 |50| Normal input
 |51| Direct input : password
 |52| Direct input : URI
 |53| Direct input : password(Google JA input)
 |54| Direct input : Raw
 |55| Toggle "Direct input"/"Input mode at startup" 
 |61| Language switch (Shift+Space)
 |62| Language switch (Alt+Space)	 External SD card
